items.title: Just $12 gets you this 4-in-1 69W car charger with a retractable USB-C cable today
items.summary:
LISEN 4-in-1 Retractable 69W Car Charger

Buy for $12 (Reg. Up to $30)

Enter promo code 3DZA77HZ for $5.09 off.

What we love

Keep your vehicle as clutter-free as possible with this all-in-one charger. It packs both USB-A and USB-C ports along with built-in retractable Lightning and USB-C cables – simply pull them out when you need power, then tuck them back in when you’re done. With a total output of 69W and up to 30W from the integrated USB-C cable, it’s ready to keep all your devices charged without the clutter.

items.title: Silent Hill f officially releases tomorrow, score an early deal down at $63 for today only
items.summary:
The brand new Silent Hill f its set for release tomorrow across all platforms and pre-orders are up at $69 on the Amazon Exclusive Day One Edition that comes with a two-sided poster and a series of pre-order bonuses: White Sailor School Uniform, Omamori: Peony, and an Item Pack. However, the folks over at Newegg are stepping in this morning with a one-day only deal on the Xbox Series X|S and Windows edition down at $62.99 using code SSE989 at checkout. These offers can sometimes sell out, but it is listed as a one-day offer and delivers the lowest price we can find anywhere for a copy on Xbox.

items.title: Hate Apple’s new iPhone 17 Pro Clear case? These elago models start from under $12 Prime shipped
items.summary:
Apple unleashed its new MagSafe Clear Case for iPhone 17 and iPhone Air – they look more or less the same as they always have and you can already score them on sale at Amazon. The new Apple clear models for iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max, however, are a new thing all together – this year they feature a somewhat divisive white color block along the back (seen above on the left). I personally don’t mind it, if you have the Silver iPhone 17 Pro/Max anyway, but if you hate it like some folks, elago’s totally clear and MagSafe clear models are now seeing launch deals on Amazon from under $12 Prime shipped.

items.title: Voters in Guinea approve new constitution with 89% support

This is an already affordable display that typically fetches $160, but it’s available for even less right now at 40% off. Today’s deal shaves $65 off its usual going rate, marking the lowest price we’ve seen for this model. Amazon, in case you’re wondering, currently has it listed for $120 via some third-party sellers with mixed reviews, so don’t let this Newegg offer slide if you’re looking to pick up a new monitor for your battlestation.
